channel.title: Saieesh's Second Brain on
channel.description: Recent content in Saieesh's Second Brain on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

item.title: ATP
item.description: ATP Adenine + Ribose = Adenosine Adenosine + Three phosphates = ATP

item.title: Bases
item.description: Bases [!tip] Don’t spend your time memorizing structures of the bases altogether. Try to remember the differences between them instead.

item.title: Beginnings
item.description: The Central Dogma Replication and Transcription differ: How? Replication Transcription Nucleic Acid DNA is formed RNA is formed Length of Nucleic Acid Larger Much, much smaller Enzymes DNA polymerase RNA polymerase Phases of cell cycle Only in S phase All throughout Interphase [!

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: DNA
item.description: DNA Types of DNA: Double Stranded DNA ![[/Images/dnastructure.png]] In the deoxyribose sugar, 1’ carbon is connected to the Nitrogen Base 2’ is not connected to a hydroxyl moiety 5’ is connected to a phosphate group 3’ is connected to hydroxy moiety to which the phosphate below attaches to.

item.title: DNA Gyrase
item.description: DNA Gyrase or DNA topoisomerase II helps in relaxation of the overtightened DNA (or) removal of positive supercoils so that it/they can be read and replicated.

item.title: DNA Packaging
item.description: ![[Images/Pasted image 20221029122408.png]] From the normal double helix structure, addition of the [[Genetics/Histones]] proteins aside the H1 protein (H2A, H2B, H3, H4) causes the second stage shown above named as 10nm chromatin also known as nucleosomes.

item.title: DNA Replication and Repair
item.description: DNA vs RNA Polymerases DNA Polymerase Before replication begins, an RNA primer is laid on a part of a strand of the DNA to be replicated.

item.title: DNA vs RNA
item.description: DNA vs RNA [[Genetics/DNA]] RNA Deoxyribose Ribose A,G,C,T A,G,C,U Purine + Sugar = Purine(-nosine) Pyrimidine + Sugar = Pyrimidine(-idine)

item.title: Fluoroquinones
item.description: These are drugs like Ciprofloxacin and Levofloxacin which inhibit [[]]

item.title: Histones
item.description: Histones are abundant in the amino acids Lysine and Arginine. These amino acids are the reason for the +ve charge on the histone proteins.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Nucleoside
item.description: Nucleoside Adenine + Sugar on it’s 1’ carbon = Adenosine Deoxy sugar does not have a hydroxyl group at the 2’ carbon

item.title: Nucleosomes
item.description: Nucleosomes are comprised of DNA surrounding proteins termed [[Genetics/Histones]]. Histones are +vely charged while DNA is negatively charged. They contain: H1 H2A H2B H3 H4 There is only one copy of H1 but the rest of them are present in two copies.

item.title: Nucleotide
item.description: Nucleotide Phosphate is attached to the 4’ carbon of a sugar makes a nucleotide.

item.title: Progeria
item.description: Progeria is a progressive genetic disorder that causes children to age at rapid rates. ![[Images/Pasted image 20221101204609.png]]

item.title: Purines
item.description: Purines Adenine to Guanine is just a de-amination step. It goes from Amino to a Carbonyl Group Adenine has the Amino group.

item.title: Pyrimidines
item.description: Pyrimidines Deamination step of cytosine turns it into Uracil. Uracil + Methyl gives Thymine. It is catalysed by the enzyme Thymidylate Synthase.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary 🧠 sspaeti.

item.title: Telomerase
item.description: Telomerase Telomerase finishes the job DNA Polymerase started. It synthesises the ends of the chromosomes, known as telomeres. [!

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
